newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco prepares to receive Mobutu for short stay.
newsitem.headline: Morocco prepares to receive Mobutu for short stay.

text.p: Morocco prepared to receive ousted Zairean president Mobutu Sese Seko on Friday but said he planned to stay in the North African country for only a few days.
"President Mobutu has asked permission to spend a few days in Morocco for health resons before going to his permanent place of residence," the official MAP news agency said in a statement.
"Mobutu's stay in Morocco will be strictly private."
Reporters were banned from Rabat airport before Mobutu's plane arrived from Togo.
"We received clear instructions that no reporter will be allowed to attend or take pictures of president Mobutu arriving here," an Interior Ministry official said.
Mobutu was due to arrive at about 1400 GMT, he said.
Mobutu left Togo for Morocco on the presidential plane of Togolese President Gnassingbe Eyadema, officials said.
Witnesses at Lome airport said Mobutu, who is fighting prostate cancer, was supported on both sides by aides as he climbed onto the plane, which left at 0910 GMT.
Mobutu arrived in Lome from his jungle palace at Gbadolite in northern Zaire on Sunday night, a day after Laurent Kabila's rebels marched into the capital Kinshasa.
He initially landed in Togo for a technical stopover but Togolese sources said the government had reluctantly agreed to let him stay longer because of his state of health.
French Cooperation Minister Jacques Godfrain hinted on Wednesday that France might be prepared to admit Mobutu for medical treatment.
In Rabat, senior interior ministry officials and paramilitary gendarmes were seen at the airport before Mobutu's arrival.
A Reuters correspondent saw a black official limousine parked at the entrance to the airport's VIP lounge with two official 60-seat buses.
Mobutu visited Morocco for four days last February in the midst of the guerrilla war which overthrew him.
